Read-it-to-Me demonstration

Simple content group

Read-it-to-Me will run on this section because it has the 'read-it-to-me-content-group' class that the script looks for.

Content with some extra semantics

With support for SSML being nearly non-existent there isn't much we can do to affect how text is read. There are some small 'psuedo-semantic' things we can do. At the moment I have the script inject pauses around or after text that was wrapped in particular tags in the source HTML. This is done by adding in some additional punctuation in the copy of the text I send to the Speech Synthesis API.

Exaggerated example below to demonstrate

I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion. I watched C-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhäuser Gate. All those moments will be lost in time, like tears in rain.

Judge for yourself whether I got close to the spirit of Rutger Hauer's delivery: Blade Runner - Final scene, "Tears in Rain" Monologue (HD)

Content with accronyms

Some accronyms are spoken by Speech Synthesis as words (rather than a series of individually read letters) -- to make this more consistent the script adds some periods between the letters, each of which results in a short pause.

Direct Support Professionals (DSPs) provide daily support to people with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities (IDD) so they can live and participate in their communities as friends, neighbors, coworkers, students, family members, volunteers, voters, and taxpayers.
